page.title: 18VALE OF CLWYD:WOODLAND.
page.content: Some of the woodland in this area is over{100yrs. old},with a good mixture of evergreens, including pine & holly, & deciduous trees including willow, chestnuts, sycamore, beech birch & oak. Many new trees have also been planted, 1 estate has planted over {1,000 trees}.Here woods are maintained for pheasant.In addition, about 30yrs. ago a firm which produces matches planted{8,000 poplars}with a view to using them for manufacture.However since the demand for matches has declined,they are no longer needed.One batch was felled this year.Only one significant area of woodland has disappeared from 100yrs. ago and new planting has more than replaced it. Large old properties are usually set in mature trees.One house has a fine specimen of a fern beech.
